answers.answer: Numbness and tingling in the hands, feet and face and a sore tongue can be signs of a B vitamin deficiency.  Have you been tested for any B vitamin levels?  You might want to add a B complex vitamin to your diet - but be aware that it might take many weeks for you symptoms to completely disappear.  Just my humble opinion, but a Neuro/Psych test sounds like the doctor thinks you might be making this all up - something they sometimes do when they can't figure out what's wrong.

question: Hello,I have been to multiple Drs (general, ENT,Rheumatologist,gastro) for a multiple symptoms that occur during the same time period but not always at the same time.Tingling to feet, calves, shins followed by forearms, hands then facial areas nose cheeks and mouth. Sometimes tongue similar to a feeling of a burnt tongue. Also coincides with severe fatigue, joint pain and weakness (feel like I am 90) slight headaches and pain to upper left flank. I have also had multiple occurences of the sweats and shakes (blood tested during event nothing found) I have been diagnoised with Proctitus but no reason for having been inflicted with this to date.These symptoms have occured on 3 diffrent occasions in the past 7 years, and todate have been tested for Diabetes, Low blood sugar, Kidney stones, thyroid (ultrasound ruled out) and cat scans of abodominal region for other signs. I am currently scheduled for a Neuro/Psych test, my Dr says this is the last test he wanted but has given me know thoughts of what he my be looking for.Any Ideas on other things to look for?Thanks
title: Re-occuring symptoms
